result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Attorney Eric P Sheets in court by phone.  Kelly A Lehn appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Victim Witness Coordinator does appear. Court addresses issue of witness notice in bond hearings for bail jumping cases.  Court explains communication with Victim Witness Coordinator. Attorney Sheets acknowledges conversations with Attorney Lehn regarding issue.  Court adjourns.
from Judge Brazeau re: Bond Modification
Copy of Letter from Atty Sheets to Tomah VA Medical Center.
Remain at Tomah VA Hospital.  Do not leave the Tomah VA Hospital.  Do not apply for a day pass.  Travel from jail to VA hospital directly with parents.
Remain at Tomah VA Hospital.  Do not leave the Tomah VA Hospital.  Do not apply for a day pass.  Travel from jail to VA hospital directly with parents.

Defendant Patrick W Mackie in court with attorney Eric P Sheets.  Kelly A Lehn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court takes up motion for bond modification.  State strongly objects to the modification of bond.  Atty Sheets presents argument in support of motion to modify bond.  Would like $5000 cash bond modified to $2000 cash bond that would cover both his cases.  Atty Sheets addresses Mackie's treatment at VA hospital and why he was arrested and brought back to Wood County.  Suggests an additional bond condition that he can not leave the VA hospital.  

Court questions Deputy Peterson regarding his conduct in the jail.  Atty Lehn makes a final statement.  

Court wants Mackie to have treatment and modifies the $5000 cash bond in 14CF21 and $2000 recog bond in 13CT500-13CT503 conditions to; remain at Tomah  VA hospital.  Do not apply for a day pass.  Do not leave the Tomah VA hospital.  Travel from jail to VA hospital directly with parents.
Defendant's Notice of Motion and Motion to Modify Bond
Not guilty pleas entered.    Bond continued

2:04 Defendant Patrick W Mackie in court with attorney Eric Sheets.  Kelly A Lehn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Leonard Lambert is sworn as a witness.  Testifies to his employment with Wis Rapids Police Dept.  Was dispatched to incident on 01/12/13 at 210 1st St N in Wis Rapids in Jennings.  Identified Patrick Mackie as the individual causing disturbance at Jenning's and points him out in the courtroom.  Testifies to what Officer Zyzewski.  

Atty Sheets cross examines the witness.  Testifies to the number of officers that responded.  Testifies to his first contact with Mackie and his opinion of the demeanor of the conversation Mackie was having.  Describes the knife that Mackie possessed and how he was opening and closing the knife.  Is not aware of Mackie pointing knife towards anyone or being abusive towards anyone.  Testifies to Mackie being escorted out of Jennings and coming back in.

Atty Lehn moves court to take judicial notice of 13CF277.  Court takes judicial notice.

Atty Sheets moves the court to dismiss.  

Court finds probable cause and binds the matter over for further proceedings.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 21, 2014 at 10:00 am.
Preliminary hearing and Arraignment on February 27, 2014 at 02:00 pm.
from Atty Sheets filing WTLPH

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing and Arraignment on February 4, 2014 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Patrick W Mackie in court with attorney Travis Slattery.  Defendant Patrick W Mackie in custody.  Derek G Dominguez appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Ct 1 transferred to Branch 2 for preliminary hearing. Waives time limits. Defendant stands mute to counts 2 & 3 and court enters not guilty plea. Bond is continued with added condition of absolute sobriety.
No contact w/Jenning's Bar.  No weapons.
issued by the District Attorney.  The issuing agency case # is WRPD14-720
